person.persName: John Courts McFerran (Glasgow, KY, U.S. Army officer)

body.p: Glasgow, Barren County, Kentucky, U.S. Army officer. Kentucky native. Son of William R. McFerran. Married to Rose H. McFerran. Graduated from the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, New York, in 1843. Brevetted to second lieutenant of the 3rd U.S. Infantry on July 1, 1843. Second lieutenant in the 7th U.S. Infantry from April 1846 to June 1846. Transferred to 3rd U.S. Infantry on June 27, 1846. Veteran of the Mexican-American War. Regimental quartermaster of the 3rd U.S. Infantry from May 1852 to October 1855. First lieutenant of the 3rd U.S. Infantry from October 1847 to December 1856. Captain and assistant quartermaster in the U.S. Quartermaster Department from August 1855 to November 1863. Major in the U.S. Quartermaster Department from November 1863 to August 1864. Colonel in the U.S. Quartermaster Department from August 1864 to June 1865. Chief quartermaster of the Department of New Mexico from September 1862 to July 1865. Chief of staff to General James H. Carleton from 1864 to 1865. Brevetted to brigadier general in 1865.
